;Recently, some parents posted videos on social media: A school uniformly delivers pre-made meals, and meat dishes are Semi-finished products, vegetables are washed, cut, sealed in plastic bags, and sent to school the next day. This was strongly opposed by parents. Subsequently, there was a huge discussion and controversy on the Internet about the safety of prepared dishes.

;

;According to Xinhua News Agency’s report on the evening of September 22, the head of the relevant departments and bureaus of the Ministry of Education said in an interview with reporters that in view of the fact that there is currently no unified standard system, certification system, traceability system, etc. for pre-made dishes. The supervision mechanism should be very cautious about "prepared dishes entering campus" and should not promote them into campus.

;

;The Ministry of Education expressed its position on "prepared dishes entering schools" and responded to many parents' questions. Looking back on the discussions and controversies that have occurred on this topic these days, the views and attitudes of those directly involved, especially parents, should be fully respected. Although some experts say that prepared dishes are as safe as fresh meat and vegetables, many parents do believe that compared to meals made on site, prepared dishes pose more food safety risks. The safety and nutrition of school meals is by no means a trivial matter. Ensuring children’s dietary health is more related to the future. Only based on this premise can our understanding and analysis of this issue have real value.

;

;First of all, after this debate, the safety of prepared dishes should be given full attention.

;

;It must be clear that it is biased to simply conclude that pre-prepared dishes are safe or unsafe, because pre-prepared dishes are different from pre-prepared dishes. They have the same name "pre-prepared dishes", but each person The understanding of the denotation and connotation of this concept may vary widely. The pre-made dishes with the same name are obviously different from those produced by small workshops. They also sell pre-made and ready-to-eat beef and salad. Big supermarkets use refrigeration to keep fresh, while roadside stalls allow them to be exposed to the scorching sun. The safety and quality are also guaranteed. different.

;

;The following are common pre-prepared dishes: 1. Self-heating hot pot, high in oil and salt, stored at room temperature. It is very convenient to eat, but obviously cannot be eaten often; 2. Frozen storage introduced by some manufacturers . Heat-and-eat dishes, such as "Kung Pao Chicken" and "Ma Po Tofu", are also high in oil and salt, and their taste is obviously inferior to those freshly made in restaurants; 3. From breeding and planting bases to industrialized assembly lines, they are processed into semi-finished products, and then The whole process is uninterrupted cold chain transportation and distribution, and restaurants and canteens purchase it and then make it into finished products.

;

;From the perspective of health and taste, the first two are obviously not eaten frequently, so they cannot become mainstream. The third type is the development direction of prepared dishes worthy of discussion. If they are not stored properly or the cold chain cannot be guaranteed to be uninterrupted, these three types of prepared dishes may have safety issues. Prepared vegetables have a long chain of production process, from breeding and planting to slaughtering, processing, and cold chain transportation and distribution. Every link has safety risks, so scientific management is required to control risks and strictly follow operating procedures. Production.

;

;Secondly, some parents are opposed to the introduction of prepared dishes into schools, which also reflects parents’ dissatisfaction with school cafeterias and schools for ignoring their rights to know, supervise and choose.

;

;Some parents reported that the school did not seek their opinions and made a unilateral decision to bring pre-made dishes to campus. To say what parents are opposed to in their hearts, in addition to concerns about the prepared dishes themselves, they also include but are not limited to the opacity of school management in the canteen, which makes their rights to know, supervise and choose missing or in vain, etc.

;

;There is a parent group in my child’s primary school, which fully described a parent’s experience of supervising the canteen: Because some children reported that the dishes were small and tasted bad, some parents went to try them at noon one day ( This is the right of parental supervision recognized by the school). As a result, the dishes on that day were rich and tasted good. A parent who went to supervise said: "My daughter came back and said that the food was unpalatable in the past two days. On the day I went, I was satisfied. There was plenty of meat in the dishes on the day I went." This may not have anything to do with the school, but this is how the catering company deals with parents. I believe there are more than one or two parents who are dissatisfied with their children’s meals at school.

;

;Think about the fact that the right to operate a canteen in some schools can be sold for millions. Parents often have no say in the selection of catering companies. It is not difficult to understand parents' distrust of schools and school cafeterias. In fact, even if there are no pre-prepared dishes, the meat bought freshly from the market may contain illegally added clenbuterol, and the vegetables may also contain excessive pesticide residues. Therefore, deciding whether it is safe or not based on fresh vs. frozen or pre-made is not the core or the most critical point of the problem.

;

;How to build parents’ confidence in schools and school cafeterias? The solution is also simple: take necessary measures to establish or re-establish the trust that should exist.

;

;First, parents should have a certain right to speak and full rights to know and supervise in selecting the dishes prepared by catering companies, canteens or catering companies every day. If every parent wants to understand and participate informedly, they can do so at any time without hindrance. Sunshine is the best disinfectant. Transparency, openness and frankness can dispel all kinds of suspicions, concerns and worries. Schools, canteens or catering companies should be open-minded and act in accordance with conscience, operating procedures and professional ethics, and are not afraid of routine or surprise supervision from parents.

;

;Second, all teachers and administrators in the school should eat the same dishes as the students. It can not only demonstrate the equality between teachers and students, but also, if both teachers and principals eat it, any concerns about food safety can be instantly eliminated, killing two birds with one stone. On this basis, parents' trust in the school can be rebuilt. Only with trust can there be healthy and effective communication, and we can clarify various misunderstandings and solve various problems at any time. Children will also have more trust and identification with the school.

;

;If you achieve these two points, many things will be solved easily. "Whether prepared dishes can be brought to campus" should be a matter of public discussion: What are the pros and cons of using prepared dishes or fresh meat and vegetables, and what is the difference in cost? Which catering company should you choose that is more conscientious and has guaranteed food safety? If canteens and catering companies use pre-prepared dishes, which company should they use? etc. Moreover, when parents have the right to speak, know, and participate, I believe that whether it is a catering company or a food production company, the first consideration is how to win the trust of parents, and the school cafeteria will have better safety.

; Sat, 23 Sep 2023 12:25:02 +0800 一桩谋杀案引发外交纠纷：加拿大成了印度头号敌人？丨智库视点http://www.infzm.com/contents/257462

;

;On September 19, 2023, the Indian Ministry of Foreign Affairs announced the expulsion of a senior Canadian diplomat in retaliation for earlier At that time, Canada expelled the head of the Indian intelligence agency who was stationed in Canada as a diplomat.

;

;Previously, the Canadian government accused "Indian government personnel" of being involved in the murder of Canadian citizen Hardeep Singh Nijjar, but this was firmly denied by India.

;

;Nijar is the leader of the Canadian Sikh community. On June 18, he was murdered outside a Sikh cultural center in British Columbia, Canada. The case triggered strong protests from the Canadian Sikh community, demanding that the Canadian government solve the case as soon as possible and bring the murderer to justice.

;

;On September 18, Canadian Prime Minister Trudeau mentioned the matter when speaking in the House of Commons, saying that he had obtained "credible" evidence that the Indian government was involved.

;

;India and Canada are far apart. Why does a case that happened thousands of miles away involve the Indian government? Why did the latter react so violently? This is related to the "Khalistan" (that is, the Sikh independence movement) movement in India.

;

;How to solve the issue of the status of the Sikhs has always been a family scandal that successive Indian governments have tried hard to cover up. The incident of India and Canada expelling diplomats from each other has once again attracted widespread attention from the international community.

;

;;Are you no longer afraid of exposing family scandals;;? ;

;

;Successive Indian governments have always been highly vigilant about the return of the "Khalistan" movement. When the governments of countries where overseas Sikhs live show support and condone behavior, India will use various channels to implement measures. pressure, but generally adhere to the principle of low-key handling in order to minimize the opportunity for the "Khalistan" movement to express its claims.

;

;After taking office, the Modi government has shown new thinking on ethnic issues, and its domestic and foreign policies and statements have become increasingly stronger.

;

;Domestically, the Modi government’s economic and social development policies continue to sacrifice the well-being of India’s minority groups. Violent incidents against ethnic minorities by Hindu extremist organizations occur from time to time, and the economic and social conditions of the Sikhs in India are deteriorating day by day.

;

;Abroad, Modi insists on exporting Hindu nationalist ideas among overseas Indians. Whenever he visits foreign countries, he will use Hindu elements to hold large gatherings to build support for the cause of Hindu nationalism among overseas Hindus. . The Modi government's ethnic policies have successfully brought sharply antagonistic ethnic relations at home to Indian groups overseas.

;

;In 2002, Modi was serving as Chief Minister of Gujarat. The state government led by him was accused of adopting a policy of inaction in response to riots and even condoning attacks, resulting in thousands of casualties.

;

;After taking office as Prime Minister of India, Modi took a very strong position on the issue of overseas Sikhs.

;

;The first is to increase pressure on host governments and require these countries to take practical measures to combat so-called anti-India activities in their own countries. Senior Indian officials have repeatedly accused the United States and Europe of using the "Khalistan" movement to involve issues of Indian sovereignty in public.

;

;The second is to support overseas Hindus and rush to the forefront of opposing overseas Sikhs. Overseas, when Sikh demonstrations occur, overseas Hindus are often arranged to hold tit-for-tat activities at the same time. People from both sides exchanged insults, and overseas Hindus and overseas Sikhs even caused conflicts in the streets, forcing the host government to intervene by creating social security incidents.

;

;As the United States has deepened its reliance on India, European and American countries have been less concerned about issues such as the status of the Sikhs for some time. The Modi government has emphasized its strong strategy to deal with overseas Sikh issues. It seems to be quite effective.

;

;Since the Russia-Ukraine conflict, India has not followed the United States and Europe in imposing comprehensive sanctions on Russia. Disappointed, the United States and Europe will no longer tolerate concessions to India's actions.

;

;In recent years, the intention of the United States and Europe to use the status of the Sikhs to attack India has become increasingly obvious. The United States took the lead in attacking India. For example, in May 2022, the state of Connecticut passed a resolution declaring that April 29 was recognized as the "Sikh Declaration of Independence Day."

;

;As we enter 2023, "Khalistan" gatherings have occurred one after another in the United States, Australia and the United Kingdom, and activists have also had violent clashes with local Indians.

;

;In Canada, anti-India demonstrations have also occurred frequently since 2023, and India-Canada relations have continued to be tense.

;

;;Confrontation;

;

;Canada has expressed its views on the Sikh issue from time to time. India has always been quite dissatisfied and regards Canada as the overseas base camp of the "Khalistan" movement. one.

;

;At present, the number of Sikhs in Canada is about 770,000, accounting for about 2.21% of Canada’s total population, which is equivalent to the proportion of Sikhs in India’s total population. Sikhs generally develop well in Canada, have higher economic and social status, and have greater political influence in the local area. For example, when Trudeau became Prime Minister of Canada in 2015, his cabinet included four Sikh ministerial officials. Sikhs also have a relatively high representation rate in Canadian parliaments at all levels.

;

;When Modi first took office as Prime Minister of India, he had quarrels with Canada over the Sikh issue.

;

;In April 2015, when Modi paid his first state visit to Canada, India attached great importance to it. However, some organizations in Canada immediately held protests and marches, demanding that the Canadian government investigate Modi’s 2002 murder in Gujarat. A high-profile state visit was tarnished by his dereliction of duty amid ethnic riots.

;

;As the United States and Europe begin to revisit this disagreement, India and Canada have had many confrontations over the Sikh issue, adding uncertainties to the already troubled bilateral relations.

;

;In Canada, two incidents occurred in June 2023, exacerbating tensions between the two sides.

;

;First, on June 4, the Sikhs held a parade to protest against the "Operation Blue Star" launched by the Indian government that year, and used a float parade to recreate the scene of Indira Gandhi's assassination. . The Indian government protests that Canada has violated its sovereignty and dignity.

;

;Then on June 18, Nijar, the famous leader of Canada’s “Khalistan Independence Referendum”, was shot dead by two gunmen in the street.

;

;Even if Canada's concerns about the Sikhs in India are not taken into account, the Indian government's involvement in the assassination of a Canadian citizen has involved Canadian sovereignty and is a serious criminal case. This can be said to have touched the bottom line of the Canadian government. .

;

;During the G20 summit in early September, the host Modi did not hold a one-on-one meeting with Trudeau. Instead, he expressed "strong concern" about "Canadian extremists' continued anti-India activities", which triggered strong opposition from Canada. dissatisfied. Then came Trudeau’s latest briefing on the Nijar incident mentioned above, emphasizing that he had obtained “credible” evidence and that the Modi government could not escape its involvement.

;

;India and Canada not only expelled diplomats from each other, but also interrupted negotiations on a free trade agreement.

;

;;The Sikh Question;;,;;India’s;;";;Thunder";; strong>;

;

;India's "dissension" on the Sikh issue has a lot to do with the historical grievances of ethnic conflicts in India that led to the emigration of Sikhs overseas.

;

;According to the latest census by the Population Registration and Survey Commission of India, there are about 20 million Sikhs, accounting for about 2% of the total Hindu population. The Indian state of Punjab has one of the largest concentrations of Sikhs. Punjab has a total population of 27.7 million, of which 57.69%, or about 16 million, believe in Sikhism. In Punjab, the Sikhs are the majority ethnic group. From a nationwide perspective in India, the Sikhs are an absolute minority. This situation has created a unique political status for the Sikhs.

;

;Sikhism originated in India in the 15th century. The founder, Guru Nanak, opposed the caste oppression of Hinduism and put forward the slogan of "everyone is equal and treats others equally". The Sikh ethnic group has strong internal cohesion and a martial ethos. They are hard-working and hard-working, and have a high economic and social status in India. However, the political status of the Sikhs is one of India's most sensitive internal affairs issues.

;

;Since India’s independence, the Sikhs have always hoped to gain more autonomy under the Indian federal system. The decentralization movements carried out at different times have also achieved certain results, including the original Punjab state being divided into two parts in 1966. Second, this made the Sikhs the majority ethnic group in a local state for the first time in history.

;

;In the late 1970s, the Sikhs in Punjab, India once again launched a non-violent regional autonomy movement, but the Indian government took strong measures to suppress it, especially the "Blue Massacre" on June 3, 1984. "Operation Star" had the greatest impact. At that time, the Indian armed forces used heavy equipment including tanks, artillery and helicopters to attack the Golden Temple in Amritsar where militants were entrenched, causing huge casualties and damaging the sacred Golden Temple building.

;

;The Sikhs compared "Operation Blue Star" with the foreign invasions and massacres they encountered in history, which aroused the sentiments of the Sikhs at home and abroad with the same hatred. Sikh soldiers mutinied in many places in India. . "Operation Blue Star" caused serious antagonism between Sikhs and Hindus.

;

;As one of the acts of retaliation, on October 31, 1984, the then Indian Prime Minister Indira Gandhi was assassinated by two of her Sikh bodyguards. Indira's assassination triggered a mass crisis in India. A wide range of Hindu attacks on Sikhs killed at least 3,000 Sikhs. Since then, the relationship between the two ethnic groups has become completely antagonistic, and the incident has gradually evolved into an armed separatist rebellion by the Sikhs fighting for independence.

;

;By 1993, the "Khalistan Movement" rebellion was considered largely quelled, causing a total of 21,443 deaths during this period, including 11,694 civilians, 1,746 armed forces soldiers, and 8,003 militants . Since then, many Sikhs have emigrated overseas, mainly to the United States, Canada, Britain, Australia and other countries. Today, about 1.5 million Sikhs live outside India and have become an important part of overseas Indians. However, the Indian government offended the memory of the Shwedagon Temple and the large-scale pursuit and killing of Sikh people in "Operation Blue Star" , continues to exist among Sikhs overseas.

;

;As of now, the incident is still unfolding, and the United States, Australia and the United Kingdom have all expressed serious concerns. It is still unclear whether India is certain that Trudeau will not disclose key evidence in the case, or whether Trudeau has produced evidence to pin Modi on the pillar of shame for continuing to persecute the Sikhs.

;

;In fact, the most injured person in the whole incident was the third party, the United States. The Biden administration in the United States has made great efforts in recent years to build the so-called alliance of democracies. Whether it is the four-nation grouping of the United States, Japan, India, and Australia, or the "Five Eyes" alliance of the United States, Britain, Canada, Australia, and New Zealand, the two parties involved in the incident are important members.

;

;Now that the Democratic Alliance has not yet been established and cracks are appearing, will the United States, as the leader of the alliance, personally mediate? How effective can mediation be? We'll see.

;

;(The author is an associate researcher at the South Asia Research Center of Fudan University)

;Recently, the topic of "prepared dishes entering campus" in some places has attracted widespread attention from society. Recently, reporters interviewed the heads of relevant departments and bureaus of the Ministry of Education regarding "prepared dishes entering campuses."

;

;According to the person in charge, school food safety and nutritional health are related to the healthy growth of students. The Ministry of Education has long been working with relevant departments to effectively implement the decisions and arrangements of the Party Central Committee and the State Council, and strictly implement the Food Safety Law and other laws regulations, and has successively formulated and implemented regulations such as the "Regulations on the Management of Food Safety and Nutrition and Health in Schools" and the "Guidelines for the Construction of Nutrition and Healthy Schools" to continuously strengthen the management of school food safety and nutrition and health.

;

;Article 57 of the Food Safety Law stipulates that canteens of schools and other centralized dining units must strictly abide by laws, regulations and food safety standards; those who order food from catering units must obtain food production and operation licenses from The enterprise orders and inspects the ordered food as required. Catering units should strictly abide by laws, regulations and food safety standards when processing meals to ensure food safety.

;

;The person in charge pointed out that the party and the government attach great importance to school food safety and are very concerned about the healthy growth of students. Parents expect their children to eat green, safe, nutritious and healthy food in school. After research, given that there is currently no unified standard system, certification system, traceability system and other effective regulatory mechanisms for prepared dishes, a very cautious attitude should be taken when "prepared dishes are brought to campus" and it is not appropriate to promote them into campuses.

;

;The most effortless social identity a person can acquire from birth is "son or daughter". As life progresses, a variety of new social identities will be acquired, including occupations, titles, Relationships, political identities, and more. When a person interrupts the process, deviates from the life trajectory preset by mainstream concepts, and retreats from society to the family, what words can he use to define himself?

;

;In the 1980s, British society classified people who were not employed, enrolled in higher education, or furthered as NEET (Not in Employment, Education or Training). This term was adopted when it was introduced to Japan and Taiwan. The transliteration of "Nite tribe" is translated as "gnawing old tribe" in mainland China. But the "elder-gnawing behavior" is not limited to "elder-gnawers." According to a China Family Tracking Survey by Peking University, the proportion of "elder-gnawers" among my country's working-age population jumped from less than 2% in 2010 to 40% in 2018. %above.

;

;Japanese scholar Yamada Hiromasa proposed the term "single parasites" in 1999, which is more specific than NEET. It refers to those who have been delaying marriage and rely on their parents for daily life such as housing and food. People who use their income as "pocket money". The male protagonist of the Japanese drama "My Story is a Long Story" is a "single parasite".

;

;Whether it is "gnawing at the old" or "single parasitism", the words themselves have a certain derogatory color, and are only measured by social value. In the context of unavoidable stigma, some people who have returned to their families choose to define themselves as "full-time children". Apart from all external social identities, they are at least the children of their parents.

;

;Having full-time children is not a large number, nor is it an option that can be easily replicated, but it has caused a huge amount of discussion on the Internet. Rather than what a full-time son or daughter is or how to be a full-time son or daughter, we are more concerned about why they give up other identities. The reason why they have become full-time children is not only due to themselves, but also has a lot to do with the common difficulties they face in this era, but they have not been able to overcome it for the time being, or have given up the fight.

;

;;

;

;;(Chen Zhitong/Picture);

;

;Single sojourn

;

;In The popularity of exchanges in the Douban group "Exchange Center for Full-time Children's Work" has subsided. Old posts from the past are constantly being dug up by students and reporters in journalism and sociology, showing a strong sense of exploration into "full-time children". Such inquiries sometimes arouse resentment. Some people couldn't help but post and ask, "Why are people suddenly paying attention to full-time children?" Most of the people who responded thought it was hype and hot-button pursuit.

;

;The most active period of the group is from January to April 2023. Many people who choose to describe themselves as "full-time children" share their stories publicly. In these stories, happiness and relaxation are rare, and anxiety and confusion are the main themes: "I feel that my sense of worth is very low" "I am especially tired when facing relatives, and my parents sometimes show dissatisfaction" "I have already started to feel anxious in the third week" "...Some people also mentioned that some people who become full-time children are under peer pressure and are easily traumatized - they are out of touch with the mainstream development path of society.

;

;The definition of full-time children in the group introduction is somewhat similar to the "single parasitic family": single young people, living in their parents' homes and enjoying financial assistance from their parents. The difference is that full-time children will work hard in exchange for financial assistance, and they do not give up employment, but keep studying, waiting for opportunities to return to the workplace, or take public postgraduate entrance examinations.

;

;This definition is consistent with most full-time children aged 20-30, although it is not applicable to those over 30 years old.

;

;Xixi is 26 years old, and her situation fits the definition of a full-time child. After graduating from an overseas master's degree in December 2022, she went through various considerations of applying for a doctorate and finding a job, and finally chose to concentrate on preparing for the civil service exam at home. The background of her circle of friends is Russell's famous saying: "Don't feel guilty for sleeping in, because you can't create much value when you get up."

;

;Xixi believes that major has the greatest influence on her career choice. She majored in education. “Two of my classmates from the same school who studied accounting and marketing quickly joined the workforce. One joined PricewaterhouseCoopers and the other joined Mercedes-Benz. But these big companies don’t require education. student." Her original career plan was to enter a university after completing her Ph.D., but during the four months of applying in 2022, she felt tremendous pressure. Being infected with the new crown epidemic in December was the last straw that crushed her. The application was abandoned. Later, when she accidentally opened her mailbox, Xixi discovered that she had received an offer from the University of Birmingham in the UK, but by that time she had missed the deadline to apply for a scholarship. "It is too low cost to spend millions to study for a doctorate in liberal arts at your own expense."

;

; "A 985 master's degree in liberal arts is not as good as a bachelor's degree in computer science with three majors." Xixi felt this from the salary. A friend of hers joined an Internet company after graduating with a bachelor's degree in computer science. After a few years, his annual salary rose to 600,000 yuan. When she was applying for a master's degree, she briefly found a job with a monthly salary of only 3,000 yuan.

;

;When taking the civil service exam this time, Xixi did not prepare for the exam while working as she did when applying for a master's degree. She found that the competition is too fierce now, and the number of people taking the civil service exam has increased significantly in recent years. Taking the National Civil Service Examination as an example, since 2021, the number of applicants has increased by about 500,000 every year, reaching 1.51 million in 2021 and exceeding 2.5 million in 2023.

;

;Xixi’s parents supported her decision to stay at home and find a job. Her father said to her: “Don’t worry, you can slowly find a job that you are more satisfied with.” One of her classmates was not so lucky. The family's financial situation is good, but his parents really wanted him to find a job as soon as possible after graduating from the master's degree. He could only find a job as a counselor in a local technical secondary school in a hurry, with a monthly salary of two to three thousand, and the work was very tiring. “He wanted to take the entrance examination for a certain position, but he had no energy to review after work, so he was caught in a dilemma: he was reluctant to give up his current job because he was afraid that he would not be able to find another job in the future; he was tired, unhappy and had little money if he didn’t give up. ”

;

;With the lessons learned from her classmates, Xixi prepares for the provincial exam with peace of mind at home. Her family's finances are jointly managed by her parents and her. She can freely use the fraction of her savings, which is enough to cover her living expenses, but she does not have to take on housework. "I mainly want to be a companion." After going to college, Xixi rarely grew up like this. Spending time living with her parents, my mother cherishes her days at home. Every night, my parents watch TV in the living room, while Xixi does aerobics. One day when Xixi went to her room to exercise, her mother asked unaccustomedly, "Why don't you dance outside today?" ;A few days ago, "A guy with a monthly salary of 6,000 yuan rewarded a female anchor with 90 million yuan for meeting a female anchor" became a hot search topic.

;

;Concept-oriented Petzold

;

;Among contemporary German film directors, Christian Petzold may be the most eye-catching of one. The previous "Ghost Trilogy" (;"The Abode of the Heart", "Ghost" and "Yela";) and "Immigration Trilogy" "Music" (;"Barbara", "Phoenix" and "Transit";), which has earned him a good reputation in the international film industry . So he struck while the iron was hot and continued to launch a series of works with the theme of "Elemental Elves". "Undine" (;2020;) with the theme of the water goddess is the first film in the series; it won the jury award at the 2023 Berlin Film Festival The grand prize of the group, "Red Sky" with the theme of the fire elf Salomanda, is the second installment in this series.

;

;By sorting out Petzold’s creative trajectory, we can find some obvious characteristics. His works are highly intellectual, and he will provide almost essay-like explanations around certain specific themes. At the same time, he places great emphasis on the core position occupied by concepts. Under the guidance of such creative concepts, the fate of classical mythological characters overlaps with the situation of modern Germans (;"Phoenix";), the plight of the Jews during World War II also collided with the fate of Arab refugees in contemporary Europe (;"Transit";), stirring up a wonderful chemical reaction.

;

;But we also have to point out that although the concept of Petzold's film is charming, it is slightly rigid in terms of flesh and texture, and lacks some real and perceptible vitality. This problem is particularly exposed in Undine: an attempt to combine a water spirit from classical mythology with the life of a contemporary German industrial diver, which is very interesting on paper, but fails to translate into images In the end, it is easy to fall into the predicament of wildly swinging between the metaphysical and the physical, and end up relying on neither.

;

;Petzold must have realized his mistake in Undine. Therefore, when filming his new work "Red Sky", he sought a lighter brushstroke: the metaphysical mythological elements are hidden deeper, while the metaphysical daily life is pushed to the foreground. The plot is set during a summer vacation. Leon, a troubled young writer, is invited to his friend Felix's seaside holiday home to try to finish the novel in a quiet environment while waiting for the publisher's decision. But during this period of time that should have calmed him down, he passively got acquainted with the beautiful and lively girl Nadia, and her lover Devi who had a close relationship with her. Leon's heart was stirred up, but the approaching deadline (;Deadline;) and the burden of intellectuals made him Nadia's emotions become tangled and twisted, creating a series of comedies and dramas in the lives of four people. At the same time, a wildfire is spreading inland, becoming the disturbing background sound of the entire story. No one knows whether this light vacation will eventually end in raging flames.

;

;Like the titles of many of Petzold's previous films, "Red Sky" is also full of potential. It not only refers to the sky dyed red by wildfires on a concrete level, but also metaphorically alludes to the sexual tension that is about to emerge between the several protagonists, as well as the overwhelming sexual tension in the "Revelation" volume of the New Testament. Apocalyptic scene. But the film's story ultimately fails to live up to the full potential of its title. The huge destructive power of wildfires is almost wiped out by a shot of wild boars running in the forest and the off-screen deaths of two supporting characters; and "Memento mori" (;will die;)-style death warning also fails to be integrated with the character's desires. In the final analysis, "Red Sky" still tells the story of a self-centered male protagonist chasing the heroine and awakening during the pursuit. Whether it is his friends, publishers, the fire and death, or even the heroine herself, they seem to be tools that lead him to self-awakening. And there remains a huge gulf between Petzold's prowess in seductive concept-building and what can only be described as a barely above-average narrative articulation. Red Skies is an improvement over its predecessor, but there's a gap that still needs to be filled.

;

;;

;

;Hide And the master of melodrama

;

;Compared with his meek performance in narrative and expression, Petzold's ability to write romantic relationships and set off the love atmosphere is outstanding. It is easy to forget that Germans have always been famous for their seriousness, whether they are romantic poets like Goethe and Holderlin or melodrama masters like Douglas Sirk and Rainer Werner Fassbinder. He grew up nourished by the Rhine River. To a certain extent, Petzold is also the heir to the romantic mantle of his predecessors.

;

;But the valuable thing about Petzold is that his writing about love relationships not only has a German-style desperate romance, but also has a subtle temperament that is rare among European and American creators. Petzold's male protagonists always seem to be more interested in the souls of their admirers than in possessing their bodies, but they are always so shy and clumsy in their pursuit of each other that The end of happiness seems forever out of reach. In contrast, Petzold's heroines are always as erratic as wandering spirits, unable to be defined or captured. They are free souls who make no secret of their feelings for the person they love, but they always refuse to be defined as immutable symbols and never become objects. Therefore, in Petzold's film, the dislocation game of chasing and dodging has been going on. This game seems to have been going on since the birth of men and women, and it will continue until the end of the world.

;

;In "Red Sky", the setting of summer vacation and country holiday house, the lighter tone compared with Petzold's previous works, and the characters' artistic and intellectual atmosphere The conversation will more or less remind us of those in Eric Rohmer's films, those satirical ridicules of hesitant straight men with good intentions, and those under the comedic tone, which are emotionless and emotionless. perspective.

;

;But on the other hand, Petzold’s talent for creating romantic situations, his intense love for female characters, and the emotional relationships between male and female characters in his films become more intense because of evasion and restraint. , will remind people of another film master who is good at creating romantic atmosphere-Wong Kar-wai. Perhaps Paula Bell, the actress in "Transit", "Undine" and "Red Sky", has quietly become Petzold's Maggie Cheung. The plots of these movies may soon disappear from our minds, but Paula Bell's bright smile and red dress will remain in our memories for a long time. Through the male director's way, we cannot fully understand what they mean. Thoughts and feelings, but still (;or - precisely because of this;) eyes full of admiration.

; Fri, 22 Sep 2023 22:25:03 +0800 餐厅员工发顾客打娃视频后赔1万离职，警方如此调解令人费解http://www.infzm.com/contents/257400

;According to reports, on September 19, a Western restaurant stopped a mother from beating her daughter and posted the relevant video online. The employee, Mr. Jiang, resigned and left Changsha after compensating the other party 10,000 yuan.

;

;The surveillance video that Mr. Jiang previously posted online showed that the woman involved, Hu, was holding a shopping bag and yelling at the little girl. Later, she took her child to the Western restaurant where Mr. Jiang worked and asked her child to explain to her the process of causing trouble. At this moment, Hu lost control. He put down the shopping bag in his hand, lifted the chair next to him and tried to hit the girl. Mr. Jiang and his colleagues stepped forward to stop him. A nearby merchant revealed in an interview with a reporter from Hunan TV that when the mother and daughter passed by his store, the girl suddenly fell down and the ice cream in her hand spilled on the floor, causing her clothes to be stained. Immediately, Hu lost control of his emotions.

;

;Mr. Jiang said that after the incident, Hu came to the restaurant many times, saying that he should not have spread the video online and threatened to die in the restaurant. After mediation by the local police station, Mr. Jiang paid the other party 10,000 yuan in compensation for mental losses and medical expenses, and then voluntarily submitted his resignation to his boss. Netizens expressed: "Those who hit people are fine, but those who stopped them will be punished", "I really feel sorry for this doll when I see this video", and some netizens said, "It's really chilling."

;

;The restaurant employee got into trouble when he prevented the woman Hu from beating her daughter in public and uploading the video to the Internet. This matter involves many aspects, including domestic violence, public supervision, privacy rights and law enforcement issues.

;

;First of all, it must be clear that Hu’s behavior of beating his daughter in public is a typical act of domestic violence. It not only violates public order and good customs, but also violates relevant laws. According to Article 2 of the Anti-Domestic Violence Law of the People's Republic of China, domestic violence refers to physical, mental and other violations committed by family members in the form of beating, binding, mutilation, restriction of personal freedom, regular verbal abuse, and intimidation. Article 5 stipulates that minors, the elderly, disabled people, pregnant and lactating women, and seriously ill patients who suffer domestic violence shall be given special protection.

;

;It is the duty of the police station to deal with Hu’s illegal behavior as soon as possible. Article 33 of the Anti-Domestic Violence Law of the People's Republic of China stipulates that if the perpetrator commits domestic violence and constitutes a violation of public security management, he shall be subject to public security management penalties in accordance with the law. It can be seen that when parents beat their children, law enforcement agencies cannot turn a blind eye on the grounds that "honest officials cannot handle household matters." In this incident, Hu publicly beat his daughter, which caused a very bad public perception.

;

;As for the restaurant employee Mr. Jiang’s behavior of publishing the video, from a legal perspective, he did not infringe on Hu’s portrait rights. Because this is an exposure of illegal activities in public places, Mr. Jiang is exercising the citizen’s right to supervise. Article 1020 of the Civil Code stipulates that the following acts may be reasonably carried out without the consent of the portrait right holder: other acts of making, using, or disclosing the portrait of the portrait right holder in order to safeguard public interests or the legitimate rights and interests of the portrait right holder. By exposing his video, Mr. Jiang obviously hopes to draw social attention to the phenomenon of domestic violence and jointly protect the rights of minors.

;

;Taking a step back, even if Hu believes that his rights and interests have been violated, he should protect his rights and interests through legal means such as litigation, rather than through improper means such as making trouble.

;

;Hu made trouble in the restaurant many times. However, the police station did not hold him accountable. Instead, through mediation, Mr. Jiang was asked to compensate 10,000 yuan for mental damages and medical expenses. This move not only chilled Mr. Jiang's heart, but also sent a wrong signal: If illegal acts can be resolved through mediation, or even reverse compensation can be obtained, wouldn't it condone more people's willful behavior? In this way, the law loses its majesty and justice.

;

;As a law enforcement agency, it should be based on the law, focus on protecting the rights and interests of minors and the courageous behavior of citizens, and have zero tolerance for illegal activities, so as to form a legal deterrent and guide social atmosphere. Improve the quality of citizens through legal education. Regrettably, the police station allowed the parties’ emotions to influence the outcome of the case, acquiescing to the woman’s behavior of “getting more and more unreasonable”. Such mediation is inconsistent with legal principles. Netizens generally questioned this mediation and expressed their simple view of justice. Law enforcement agencies should re-investigate the matter and hold the offenders accountable, rather than letting those who bravely act for justice lose money and jobs. Only in this way can people's faith in judicial authority not be damaged. After all, the majesty and credibility of the law are often reflected in the daily actions of law enforcers.

;September 13, 2023, Sevastopol, Crimea region, Smoke billowed out from the attacked shipyard ;(Visual China/Photo);

;

;Recently, Ukrainian news said that the Ukrainian military In the early morning of September 13, 2023, 10 missiles and 3 unmanned boats launched an attack on the Sevastopol military base in the Crimean Peninsula, causing a fire at the Sevastopol Shipyard and two ships under repair were damaged. The losses include the Russian Black Sea Fleet's Ropcha-class landing ship "Minsk" and the Kilo-class diesel-powered submarine "Rostov-on-Don" which cost up to US$300 million and was commissioned in 2014. Rostov-on-Don). Satellite images of the scene showed that the two ships were severely damaged and were extremely difficult and expensive to repair. Considering that such a project was difficult to complete under the wartime system, they basically had to be scrapped.

;

;Russia also admitted that it was attacked by Ukrainian missiles and that some ships were damaged. The situation announced by both sides basically confirmed the results of this attack. This is the largest loss suffered by the Black Sea Fleet since the sinking of the flagship Moskva after the war between Russia and Ukraine. It also sets a record for the first time in history that a submarine is hit by a missile. What’s even more amazing is that just two days after this attack, Ukraine announced that it had used missiles and drones to attack the S-400 air defense missile system on the Crimean Peninsula. This system has always been considered the strongest in Russia. Currently in active air defense weapons, Turkey even had tense relations with the United States and NATO in order to purchase this system. This time, it was beheaded by Ukraine behind enemy lines in actual combat, which was shocking.

;

;This round of continuous attacks with a combination of punches is obviously not the result of an accident, but a joint military operation between the Ukrainian intelligence agencies and the Ministry of Defense, in which the actions of the Ukrainian special forces can be said to be indispensable. without.

;

;Two days before launching the missile attack, that is, on September 11, the Ukrainian intelligence agency announced that the special forces had successfully seized two offshore oil and gas drilling platforms in the Black Sea and successfully removed Russian equipment from the platforms. military installations. The map shows that the two platforms captured by the Ukrainian special forces are about fifty kilometers away from the Crimean coastline. The Russian army has set up air and sea warning radars on them to control the Black Sea area.

;

;This attack did not attract much attention from domestic public opinion. Some media even believed that it was a political show after Ukraine’s counterattack failed, because the battle to seize the two platforms was not fierce and not too big. military value. However, in my opinion, the battle to seize the sea platform is the prelude to this attack, because Ukraine does not have stealth fighter equipment that can penetrate the enemy's air defense network, so it must try to shorten the reaction time of the opponent's air defense weapons, and these two This platform happens to be Russia's peripheral observation point.

;

;Before the start of the 2003 Iraq War, the U.S. military used special forces to successfully seize three Iraqi offshore drilling platforms in the Persian Gulf. On the other hand, it is to prevent Iraq from dumping oil into the Persian Gulf and polluting the environment like it did during the Gulf War.

;

;During the operation that year, in addition to the British and American special forces, the Polish Thunder Special Task Force also assumed the offensive mission of a platform. This kind of battle to seize maritime platforms is referred to as VBSS (;Visit, board, search and seize;) in the field of special operations. VBSS The mission is often only accomplished by elite maritime special operations units. The complexity of such operations lies in the fact that it involves combat maneuvers from underwater to the surface, and also includes extremely close indoor combat. It not only requires a large amount of pre-war reconnaissance, but also requires a large amount of targeted actual combat training by operational units before they can make up their minds to implement it. This kind of maritime point-taking operation generally cannot be just a political statement mission, because the risks and costs are too high.

;

;It can be seen from the missile attack two days later that Ukraine's action to seize the Black Sea drilling platform is only part of its huge action plan. In fact, the follow-up actions are the key to victory. After the submarine and landing ship were attacked by missiles, Ukraine launched a missile attack one day later. The battle rhythm seemed not compact enough. But in fact, the U.S. special forces did not delay after seizing the platform. Another attack team quietly landed on the Crimean Peninsula under the cover of night, approached the submarines and landing ships in the shipyard, and used thermal imaging Shoot it from multiple angles. After the attack, these latent special operations personnel conducted reconnaissance and assessment of the bombing effects before quietly withdrawing.

;

;Because air-launched missile attacks involve issues with the angle of incidence, it is necessary to construct a three-dimensional image of the target, and the inspection needs to confirm its radar information or thermal imaging information, all of which require multi-angle technical reconnaissance. The United States may be able to rely on its powerful satellite and reconnaissance aircraft platforms for reconnaissance. For Ukraine, which lacks technical reconnaissance means, using special forces or covert operators to conduct close reconnaissance is a good alternative. And even for a country like the United States with strong technical reconnaissance capabilities, close-in reconnaissance by special forces is still one of the optional methods. For example, during the Gulf War, the United States sent multiple special operations teams into Iraq in order to find Iraqi Scud missiles. Conduct close reconnaissance from the rear. In addition, for collecting the signal characteristics of enemy air defense weapons, deploying special operations personnel for close detection is also a very feasible method, because with only a set of signal receivers, these lurking personnel can obtain the spectrum information of surrounding warning radars for a long time , and can also obtain more comprehensive signal intelligence.

;

;Many people believe that the emergence of drones can replace special operations personnel, but in fact it is people, not machines, who win wars. Only when the quality of people matches technical means can we defeat powerful opponents.

;

;After the tornado passed through, local residents could not remember how long the strong winds blew. This sudden disaster hit parts of Suqian City and Yancheng City, Jiangsu Province on September 19, 2023. According to official reports from the two places, a total of 10 people were killed and 8 injured.

;

;Two days later, on Liyuan Road, Nancai Township, Suqian City, Li Peng had been immersed in picking up all kinds of debris at home and in the supermarket, and cleaning the passage; in another town in the city, Daxing Town North Street, a 68-year-old Chen Jianqiang climbed up to the roof of his house, collected the tiles blown by the tornado, and prepared to re-roof the roof.

;

;The two-kilometer-long Nancai Township South Street has generally returned to its usual order. Downed trees and broken glass have been cleared away, and temporary stalls are ready to be set up. Among the photos provided by local residents on the 20th, only the pears on the small truck were half burnt and blackened by the high-voltage cables that fell on the day of the tornado, and they were still stacked neatly.

;

;In this tornado, the tornadoes in Daxing Town, Suyu District, Suqian City and Nancai Township, Economic Development Zone were EF2, and the tornadoes in Lupu Town and Banhu Town, Funing County, Yancheng City were EF3. .

;

;According to the Jiangsu Provincial Meteorological Service Center’s official Weibo account “Jiangsu Meteorology”, the intensity of tornadoes is divided into levels from EF0 to EF5. Tornadoes of level EF2 and above are generally called strong tornadoes, and tornadoes of level EF2 are generally called strong tornadoes. It can cause considerable damage, it can uproot trees; an EF3 tornado can even knock over a train.

;

;In Suqian, tornadoes are not a common natural disaster and they come and go quickly. In Yancheng, according to the Propaganda Department of the Funing County Party Committee in Yancheng City, an average of 4.8 tornadoes occur in Jiangsu every year, of which 2.6 occur in Yancheng. Yancheng is the urban area with the highest frequency of occurrence.

;

;“I was so scared at that moment”

;

;When the tornado hit at around 5 o’clock in the evening on September 19, Luo Qi was picking up his children from school and did not notice it. figure.

;

;When I got home, the street was in a mess. Luo Qi saw that on South Street, electric wires were blazing and cars were on fire. There is a small market on the street every day, right in front of Luo Qi's house. One of the sheds in front of her house was blown away and disappeared, and the other one was tied to a tree with a rope, but it hit the freezer.

;

;Luo Qi checked the surveillance video at home and found that the three minutes before the tornado struck were unusually calm, with only light rain falling. Starting at 17:11, the surveillance video recorded a loud wind noise, and the shed at the door was blown. Then the wind became louder and louder, a red four-corner tent floated by the roadside, the big box was blown away, and all the small objects on the ground began to fly everywhere.

;

;Luo Qi said that the child's grandmother was washing vegetables at the door. When she saw something was wrong and wanted to go back into the house, the tricycle was blown up by the wind and pushed against the wall. The car window glass penetrated her elbows and feet, and she went to the hospital that night for stitches.

;

;The stall owner next to Luo Qi’s house was not so lucky. He was picked up by the wind and fell to the other side of the road. At that time, a wrist-thick main cable suddenly fell down on the street, bursting into flames, and everyone was afraid of being electrocuted. "I was so frightened at that moment." Luo Qi said that it was the first time in more than 30 years that she had seen such a violent tornado. The stall owner's wife kept asking for help, but no one dared to rescue her. Later, the police cordoned off the scene, and the cables were still on fire after the power was artificially cut off.

;

;On Liyuan Road, which intersects with South Street, Li Peng opened a small supermarket. In his memory, the tornado lasted no more than a few minutes. But in those few minutes, the tornado tore off almost all the roofs on both sides of the street. "Those asbestos tiles and sheds were hanging in the sky, as high as an airplane, blowing everywhere."

;

;Li Peng’s home is a 16-year-old tile-roofed house. Since the house has never had any problems before, Li Peng has not reinforced or renovated the house. The tile-roofed house suffered heavy losses in this tornado. The roof kept leaking and the furniture and doors inside were smashed. "I haven't calculated the amount of damage. I can only make detailed statistics when repairs start."

;

;When the tornado moved all the way to Daxing Town, it was already around 6 o'clock. Fante, a 14-year-old girl, just came home from school. She saw a black thing slowly rolling up from a distance. "It seemed to be connected to the sky, very long." During dinner, the lights at home flickered on and off, and soon the power went out. A strong wind blew into Fanter's house. Grandma went to block the two glass doors, but she couldn't close them. Fanter ran to help, "but there was a strong suction that sucked me to the door and blew me into the tree." Fanter, who weighed 85 pounds, hugged the big tree outside the door and did not dare to move. He did not come down along the trunk until the wind stopped.

;

;According to "Jiangsu Weather" news on September 20, Jiangsu was affected by two tornadoes on September 19. The first tornado was in Suqian Economic Development Zone and Daxing Town from 17:00 to 18:00; the other was in Funing County, Yancheng City from 20:16 to 35:00.

;

;According to the official public account of the Suqian Emergency Management Bureau, the tornado disaster mainly occurred in towns and villages, with densely populated areas, complex building structures, and the occurrence period coincided with off-duty hours. According to preliminary statistics, 5,512 people were affected by the strong tornado, 1,646 houses were generally damaged, 137 houses collapsed, 41.8 hectares of crops were damaged, 405 people were temporarily relocated, and some walls of more than 2,000 square meters of pig houses collapsed and the roof collapsed.

;

;;

;

;On the roadside in Nancai Township, electric workers are repairing lines. Visual China Picture ;;

;

;Public housing insurance is verifying compensation

;

;Sun Wei, assistant captain of Suqian Blue Sky Rescue Team, told Southern Weekend Reporter, a common disaster in Suqian is heavy rain. Relatively speaking, tornadoes occur more frequently in Yancheng City. The private rescue teams along the Jiangsu coast have conducted targeted training on thunderstorms and hurricanes.

;

;At around 6 pm on the 19th, 13 members of the Blue Sky Rescue Team rushed to Nancai Township, Economic Development Zone. The local fire rescue team had arrived at the scene. The Blue Sky Team members assisted in clearing down fallen trees and scattered debris. etc., to open up a smooth road; at the same time, we checked the power supply lines to prevent secondary disasters such as leakage. "We continued working until two o'clock in the morning the next day." Road cleanup in Nancai Township was basically completed on the 20th. Suqian Blue Sky Rescue Team sent 12 reinforcements to Daxing Town in the afternoon to investigate the disaster situation, mainly assisting township staff to verify whether there were any people who had lost contact after the disaster.

;

;Sun Wei said that after the tornado passes through, another task is to clean up the debris on the facade of the building. For example, the air conditioner on the edge of the eaves was blown to the outside of the bracket and needs to be adjusted. The severely damaged roof There are broken tiles on the floor, which should be cleaned as soon as possible. "Prevent the heavy rain after the tornado from falling down the originally skewed items, causing secondary disasters."

;

;For Chen Jianqiang and his wife, residents of North Street in Daxing Town, the main problem is that after the roof tiles are broken, How to fall asleep at night. Daughter Chen Guo said that the roof of her parents' house had just been renovated a few days ago, and they spent three to four thousand yuan to replace it with new tiles. Unexpectedly, the tornado ripped through most of the roof, and the electrical appliances in the house were also soaked in rain all night. Fortunately, the corridor was made of hard cement boards, so the two old men laid several layers of quilts on the corridor and spent the night. On September 20, my uncle, who was in his seventies, came to help repair the roof. I didn’t know when it would be repaired. Someone from the village registered the loss of the house, but the old man didn't know how to subsidize it in the future.

;

;On the evening of September 20, the Suqian Emergency Management Bureau issued a WeChat article stating that it had insured urban and rural residents of Suqian City with public safety urban and rural assistance insurance, which would cover urban and rural housing in Suqian City due to floods and typhoons. Compensation for house losses caused by natural disasters such as landslides, landslides, fires and explosions. The compensation standard is that for urban housing, the main structure insurance amount is 180,000 yuan/household, and the interior decoration insurance amount is 120,000 yuan/household; for rural housing, the main structure insurance amount is 180,000 yuan/household, and the interior decoration insurance amount is 40,000 yuan/household. .

;

;The underwriter of this project is mainly the Suqian Branch of the People's Insurance Company of China Co., Ltd. Zheng Xinbo, the company's contact person, told Southern Weekend reporters that this private housing insurance is purchased by the government, and each household pays 2 yuan. , have been purchasing continuously for many years. After the disaster occurred, they sent more than 30 staff to the villages and towns on the 20th to verify the damage and determine the damage. The first batch of compensation will be completed before the National Day holiday.

;

;Relatively speaking, Yancheng City has more experience in dealing with tornadoes. Public information shows that on June 23, 2012, Yancheng ;City;;;Funing;;;,;;;Sheyang;;;;An EF4 tornado occurred in some areas, with winds exceeding level 17. 99 people were killed and 846 injured. The local government built the Yancheng Memorial Hall for Fighting the "6.23" Tornado.

;

;The Funing County Party Committee Propaganda Department stated that Funing County has also formulated corresponding emergency plans for natural disasters that occur more frequently. After the tornado, the "9.19" Typhoon Emergency Rescue Command was established in the affected town as soon as possible; special teams were arranged to go to each disaster-stricken village to find out the situation, grasp the disaster situation as soon as possible and report it quickly. Four rounds of sifting search and rescue operations were carried out overnight on September 19. In addition, 129 disaster-stricken people were urgently relocated and resettled by staying with relatives and friends, staying in hotels, etc.

;

;Jiangsu is a tornado-prone area in the country. According to "Jiangsu Meteorology" news, from 1956 to 2015, a total of 109 tornadoes occurred in Jiangsu, with the highest proportion occurring in summer, reaching 79.8%, with an annual average of 1.5.

;

;The reason why Jiangsu is prone to tornadoes is that the province has a flat terrain, dense rivers and lakes, and is located in the north-south climate transition zone. Cold and warm air currents frequently meet, which can easily form strong convective weather including tornadoes.

;

;The meteorological experts in the above article said that Jiangsu is usually less prone to tornadoes in mid-to-late September, but recently due to higher temperatures and the influence of the Jianghuai cyclone, relatively strong tornadoes have occurred. dynamic conditions. Against this background, a relatively rare tornado event occurred in Jiangsu on September 19.

;

;On the 21st, Wang Xiaohua, deputy director of the Jiangsu Provincial Meteorological Observatory, said in an interview with CCTV that the Jiangsu Provincial Meteorological Observatory has built a strong convection and strong wind demonstration system from 2021 to 2023. , some preliminary forecast and warning capabilities of tornadoes. In the next step, the meteorological department will use multi-source observation data such as multi-band radar collaborative observation to improve and optimize tornado early warning technology and indicators based on the characteristics of climate change, and further improve forecast and early warning capabilities.
